image.altText: A line of damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: These days, sirens and explosions are pretty much the only things that punctuate the silence in Kramatorsk, near Ukraine's front lines. They're a regular reminder of how Russia's military is closing in.

title.children: This city is among Putin's prizes, and 'only stupid people aren't scared'

image.altText: A dirt path cutting through a forest

props.synopsis: The alleged actions of Dezi Freeman, accused of shooting dead two police officers, reveal a tiny town fraying over anti-authoritarian ideology taken to its unthinkable extreme.

title.children: In Porepunkah, sovereign citizen thinking is splitting the community

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: The search for alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman is now in its fifth day amid predictions of storms across Victoria.

title.children: Authorities navigate rough weather as Dezi Freeman manhunt enters fifth day

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Alleged gunman's friend said he had become withdrawn
Police not ruling out charges for gunman's wife and son

image.altText: A bespectcled woman with short hair looks off camera as she poses for a headshot.

props.synopsis: Intentionally attacking civilians like aid and rescue workers, and journalists, is a violation of international humanitarian law and a war crime.

title.children: Journalist who won the prize Trump wants says US democracy 'on the edge of a cliff'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit with purple tie sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: Labor's strongest governments have often involved vibrant backbenches that took seriously the task of keeping the cabinet on its toes.

title.children: What's the point of all these Labor parliamentarians?

image.altText: Close-up of a man with a bruised and puffy face with tubes in his nose

props.synopsis: Many AFL players look forward to going back to playing the sport for fun after they leave the professional league. But it's not always a warm welcome back into the lower leagues. The ABC speaks to former stars and their families about the brutal transition out of the game.

title.children: 'I can't stand you': Ex-AFL players targeted in lower leagues

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking.

props.synopsis: But the US president says the ruling is "incorrect", and is indicating taking the case to the Supreme Court.

title.children: Most of Donald Trump's tariffs illegal, US court rules

image.altText: A woman smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: The upcoming March for Australia has drawn mixed reactions among migrants, with some fearful of anti-immigration sentiment, while others say they are not concerned.

title.children: Nationwide March for Australia sparks mixed reactions among migrants

image.altText: Adaminaby Oval

props.synopsis: Winter is almost over, but there was fresh snowfall across NSW and the ACT overnight.

title.children: Blanket of snow marks final days of winter amid Antarctic blast

image.altText: roblox child

props.synopsis: If you have kids who game you won't want to know, but will need to hear, that "paedophile hunting" is a booming genre of social media content.

title.children: Why Roblox banned a prominent paedophile hunter

image.altText: A crowded beach in Eurpoe, with many people and umbrellas on the sand.

props.synopsis: How can we keep exploring without leaving such a heavy footprint? And where should we go if we want to travel green?

title.children: Want to see the world? Here's how to leave a smaller footprint

image.altText: A woman in a hijab sits in front of a press vest

props.synopsis: Israel has killed 240 Palestinian journalists, according to a local union. Those still standing say "no one is safe".

title.children: Nour is one of Gaza's surviving journalists. She feels like she's in a 'queue to death'

image.altText: A man stoops to lay a shotgun on a pile of other guns

props.synopsis: As police hunt a suspected gunman through rugged terrain in the Victoria's High Country, there are more than 4 million registered weapons across the country.

title.children: Gun laws tightened after the Port Arthur massacre, now ownership is surging

image.altText: A man in a black puffer jacket leaves court while pretending to be on a phone call

props.synopsis: A Melbourne lawyer ripped off his victim to the tune of $482,000 with a scheme that included grandiose promises, fake court cases and fabricated legal documents.

title.children: 'Pitiful' Melbourne lawyer caught stealing from grieving widow

image.altText: A snow-covered scene in Victoria's alpine region

props.synopsis: The SES says it received more than 1,000 requests for assistance overnight, and that Victorians driving on the roads today should expect to see trees down.

title.children: Trees down and building damage in Victoria after severe wind, rain

image.altText: An American tennis player appears in distress after a match as his French opponent gives him a hug.

props.synopsis: American Ben Shelton makes a tearful exit at Flushing Meadows as the best home hope for the US Open is forced to retire with an injured shoulder, after Carlos Alcaraz overcomes an injury scare to advance to the fourth round.

title.children: 'I did something to my shoulder': American star Ben Shelton forced out of US Open

image.altText: A man in a tie leaves the courthouse as journalists and cameramen gather around.

props.synopsis: After a month-long criminal trial, celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright faces possible prison time after being found guilty on two charges of attempting to pervert the course of justice.

title.children: 'Truth about the cover-up': Matt Wright stares down prison after verdict

image.altText: Former Vice President Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: The president's former rival is due to go on tour to promote her book on her failed campaign called 107 Days.

title.children: Donald Trump cancels Kamala Harris's Secret Service protection

image.altText: Runners cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge as part of the Sydney Marathon 2024

props.synopsis: Police officers will be out in full force in Sydney's CBD as 35,000 runners are expected at the Sydney Marathon, and thousands of protesters at three separate rallies.

title.children: Marathon and three protests: Sydneysiders warned of major disruptions on Sunday

image.altText: a young woman leans against a wall staring at the camera with a somber expression

props.synopsis: From poorly categorised NDIS support to high rates of suicide, Tourette syndrome advocates say it's the last disability where "it's still acceptable for people to laugh at".

title.children: 'Loudest in the room ... yet still invisible': Tourette syndrome advocates plead for change

image.altText: a silhouette image of a mag singing while the sun sets behind him

props.synopsis: Fronted by the kin of Aussie music royalty, Elvis Kernaghan and The Min Min Lights turn outback classrooms into rock concerts.

title.children: Country legend's nephew takes 'deadly' school of rock to remote kids

image.altText: Black and white photo of a film crew standing in front of a shop front.

props.synopsis: When Disney came to Australia to film Ride a Wild Pony in the 1970s, the crew nearly returned to America to complete filming — then they found Chiltern.

title.children: How an 'unspoilt' Aussie town set the scene for a hidden gem Disney film

image.altText: Julia Roberts stands in front of a backdrop for the Venice Film Festival

props.synopsis: The Hollywood actress waved off concerns that her new film casts suspicion on women who come forward with sexual misconduct allegations, saying it's aimed at creating conversation.

title.children: Julia Roberts defends #MeToo criticism of film at Venice

image.altText: Giorgia Meloni speaking into two microphones.

props.synopsis: The website was taken down after widespread condemnation and legal complaints.

title.children: Italy's Giorgia Meloni 'disgusted' with adult website using her image

image.altText: A female with dark hair smiles and waves at the camera

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court sacks Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for ethics violation.

title.children: Thai court sacks PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra

image.altText: A boy looks at his phone showing a Tiktok account

props.synopsis: Egyptian police arrest of dozens of teenage TikTokkers, accusing them of crimes ranging from indecency to money laundering.

title.children: Egyptian police arrest teenage TikTokkers in social media crackdown

image.altText: A composite image of nine book covers on background fading from purple to orange

props.synopsis: In this month's best new releases, humans transform into trees, grief meets the supernatural in a haunted house and a volcanic eruption disrupts life in rural New Zealand.

title.children: The nine books our critics couldn't put down in August

image.altText: A composite of pictures of a dinosaur, a man and a woman embracing, and a table of food.

props.synopsis: We've collected the best, most ear-catching quotes of the week. See if you can work out who said what.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: A show-off dinosaur, a chocolate ghosting and a record store singalong

image.altText: A Roosters NRL player reaches out to put the ball down in the corner as a Melbourne defender grabs him from behind.

props.synopsis: Rugby recruit Mark Nawaqanitawase bags four tries as the Sydney Roosters scored 40 unanswered points to down Melbourne in Craig Bellamy's milestone match.

title.children: Roosters storm home, leave their Mark as Bellamy fumes over 'embarrassing' Storm loss

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man diving from a height in front of people watching and boathouses on a river

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Nelson has endured tough times over the past five years, but now a small group of friends plans to revive an event that attracted huge crowds up until the 1970s.

title.children: Can this historic regatta coax tourists back to struggling river town?

image.altText: Children holding protest signs against a tower development next to West End state school.

props.synopsis: The proposed complex is one of a number of developments planned in Brisbane in the coming years, with the population expected to grow 2.1 per cent year-on-year until 2046.

title.children: 'Difficult choices' ahead as locals protest West End tower development

image.altText: Crew preparing to shoot in WA town of Gracetown during the first week of filming of Drift.

props.synopsis: With promised local content requirements for streaming services delayed indefinitely, Australian filmmakers say the local industry is hurting.

title.children: 'Destroying aspirations': Filmmakers still waiting on content quotas

image.altText: Aboriginal man with cap and sunglasses holding two barramundi.

props.synopsis: Peter Griffiths-Sebastian went from prison to being a big part of the local community. What can help others make the same shift?

title.children: Former prisoner who rebuilt his life wants to improve others' chances

image.altText: Human waste fills to the top of a plane toilet

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has apologised after passengers on a flight from Bali to Brisbane overnight were left without any working toilets during what one described as "a filthy, humiliating nightmare".

title.children: 'One elderly woman wet herself': Passengers 'distressed' after plane's toilets stop working
